This active vitamin D increases calcium absorption in the gut and reabsorption in the kidneys, helping to restore calcium levels. Therefore, vitamin D is an integral part of the compensatory response of PTH to hypocalcemia.

The claim is supported by existing academic literature. Studies have shown that the emergence of new mutations in EGFR, such as the C797S mutation, can indeed lead to resistance to tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs). This resistance often results in treatment failure. Sequencing plasma DNA before and after the development of drug resistance can help identify these new mutations.
CONTRADICTS

CONTRADICTS

The claim contradicts the existing academic literature. ATP release is known to propagate glial calcium waves, as suggested by Cotrina et al., 1998. Furthermore, glial calcium waves have been suggested to play a role in seizures, as indicated by Gómez-Gonzalo et al., 2010. Therefore, both parts of the claim are contradicted by the cited literature.
CONTRADICTS

SUPPORTS

The claim is supported by academic literature. PTENP1, a pseudogene of PTEN, has been reported to regulate PTEN expression indirectly. The pseudogene PTENP1 can act as a molecular sponge or decoy, sequestering microRNAs that would otherwise target and degrade PTEN mRNA, thereby increasing PTEN protein levels. This means that while PTENP1 does not directly regulate PTEN expression, it can indirectly influence PTEN levels through its decoy function.
CONTRADICTS

CONTRADICTS

The existing academic literature contradicts the claim. Studies have shown that KRT17 (Keratin 17) does modulate the expression of the transcriptional regulator AIRE (autoimmune regulator) in diseased epithelia. KRT17 has been found to induce the expression of proinflammatory cytokines and support tumor progression. For instance, in psoriasis, a common skin disease, KRT17 is upregulated and it modulates the expression of AIRE, leading to the production of proinflammatory cytokines. Furthermore, KRT17 has been associated with promoting tumor growth in various types of cancers, including cervical cancer and pancreatic cancer.
